name: AmeriCorps Seniors Senior Demonstration Program (FGP) 94.017
objective: To provide grants to qualified agencies for the purpose of conducting innovative activities involving older Americans as volunteers.
top_agency_name: Corporation for National and Community Service
sub_agency_name: Corporation for National and Community Service
beneficiary_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals
Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)
U.S. Territories and possessions (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: AmeriCorps Seniors Native Nations & Indigenous Elders Senior Demonstration projects engaged 163 stipend volunteers who impacted more than 1,100 beneficiaries across Indian Country. These partnerships addressed community needs specific to Indian Country, including education, mental health, food security, language preservation, workforce development and conservation efforts. These investments highlighted AmeriCorps Seniors commitment to partnering with Tribes, and tribal serving organizations, addressing critical issues for native and indigenous communities, leveraging a long history and culture of service.

AmeriCorps Seniors Native Nations & Indigenous Elders Senior Demonstration projects engaged 163 stipend volunteers who impacted more than 1,110 beneficiaries across Indian Country.  These partnerships addressed community needs specific to Indian Country, including education, mental health, food security, language preservation, workforce development and conservation efforts.  These investments highlighted AmeriCorps Seniors commitment to partnering with Tribes, and tribal serving organization, addressing critical issues for native and indigenous communities, leveraging a long history and culture of service.

authorizations.text: Domestic Volunteer Service Act of 1973, as amended.. Domestic Volunteer Service Act of 1973. Pub. L. 93, 113. 42 U.S.C. § 5028-5028(a).

rules_regulations: AmeriCorps Seniors Grant Application (OMB Control No. 3045-0035). When federal funds are available for this program, specific guidelines will be developed.
